Package org.cesecore.util

Class LookAheadObjectInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • java.io.ObjectInputStream
        • org.cesecore.util.LookAheadObjectInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, DataInput, ObjectInput, ObjectStreamConstants, AutoCloseable
    public class LookAheadObjectInputStream
extends ObjectInputStream
    Can be used instead of ObjectInputStream to safely deserialize(readObject) unverified serialized java object. Simple usage: LookAheadObjectInputStream lookAheadObjectInputStream = new LookAheadObjectInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(someByteArray); HashSet<Class<? extends Serializable>> acceptedClasses = new HashSet<Class<? extends Serializable>>(3); acceptedClasses.add(X509Certificate.class); lookAheadObjectInputStream.setAcceptedClasses(acceptedClasses); lookAheadObjectInputStream.setMaxObjects(1); X509Certificate certificate = (X509Certificate) lookAheadObjectInputStream.readObject(); //If serialized object is not of the type X509Certificate SecurityException will be thrown See "LookAheadObjectInputStreamTest" in the test code for more examples
    Version:
    $Id: LookAheadObjectInputStream.java 34325 2020-01-17 15:40:23Z jekaterina_b_helmes $

    • Method Detail

      • getAcceptedClasses

        public Collection<Class<? extends Serializable>> getAcceptedClasses()
        Returns:
        set of accepted classes etc. Classes that are allowed to be read from this ObjectInputStream. This set can be modified with:
        See Also:
        setAcceptedClasses(java.util.Set<java.lang.Class<? extends java.io.Serializable>>)

      • isEnabledSubclassing

        public boolean isEnabledSubclassing()
        Returns:
        true if class should be accepted if it extends super class directly or indirectly that is listed in accepted class names, false otherwise.

      • setEnabledSubclassing

        public void setEnabledSubclassing​(boolean enabled,
                                  String... packagePrefixes)
        Parameters:
        enabled - True if class should be accepted if it extends super class directly or indirectly that is listed in accepted class names, false otherwise.
        packagePrefixes - An array of class name prefixes that are allowed to be sub-classed like "org.ejbca".

      • isEnabledInterfaceImplementations

        public boolean isEnabledInterfaceImplementations()
        Returns:
        true if class should be accepted if it implements an interface directly or indirectly that is listed in accepted class names, false otherwise.

      • setEnabledInterfaceImplementations

        public void setEnabledInterfaceImplementations​(boolean enabled,
                                               String... packagePrefixes)
        Parameters:
        enabled - True if class should be accepted if it extends super class directly or indirectly that is listed in accepted class names, false otherwise.
        packagePrefixes - An array of class name prefixes that implementations must comply to if set like "org.ejbca".

      • setAcceptedClasses

        public void setAcceptedClasses​(Set<Class<? extends Serializable>> acceptedClasses)
        Set accepted classes that can be deserialized using this LookAheadObjectInputStream. Primitive types (boolean, char, int,...), their wrappers (Boolean, Character, Integer,...) and String class are always accepted. All other classes have to be specified with setAcceptedClassName*
        Parameters:
        acceptedClasses - Collection of class names that will be accepted for deserializing readObject. Default: null

      • setAcceptedClasses

        public void setAcceptedClasses​(Collection<Class<? extends Serializable>> acceptedClasses)
        NOTE: If you want to re-use the same Set of accepted classes, you should use setAcceptedClasses(Set) Set accepted classes that can be deserialized using this LookAheadObjectInputStream. Primitive types (boolean, char, int,...), their wrappers (Boolean, Character, Integer,...) and String class are always accepted. All other classes have to be specified with setAcceptedClassName*
        Parameters:
        acceptedClasses - Collection of class names that will be accepted for deserializing readObject. Default: null

      • getMaxObjects

        public int getMaxObjects()
        Get maximum amount of objects that can be read with this LookAheadObjectInputStream.
        Returns:
        maximum amount of objects that can be read. Default: 1

      • setMaxObjects

        public void setMaxObjects​(int maxObjects)
        Set maximum amount of objects that can be read with this LookAheadObjectInputStream. This method will also reset internal counter for read objects.
        Parameters:
        maxObjects - maximum amount of objects that can be read. Default: 1

      • resolveClass

        protected Class<?> resolveClass​(ObjectStreamClass desc)
                         throws IOException,
                                ClassNotFoundException
        Overrides resolveClass to check Class type of serialized object before deserializing readObject.
        Overrides:
        resolveClass in class ObjectInputStream
        Throws:
        SecurityException - if serialized object is not one of following: 1) a String 2) a java primitive data type or its corresponding class wrapper 3) in the list of accepted classes 4) extends class from the list of accepted classes (if enabledSubclassing==true)
        IOException
        ClassNotFoundException

      • isClassAlwaysWhiteListed

        public static boolean isClassAlwaysWhiteListed​(Class<?> c)

      • getRequiredClassesToSerialize

        public static Set<Class<? extends Serializable>> getRequiredClassesToSerialize​(Class<?> clazz)
                                                                        throws NoClassDefFoundError
        Parameters:
        clazz - class
        Returns:
        a Set of all classes declared as non-transient, non-static field in the class and its superclasses if such is defined
        Throws:
        NoClassDefFoundError - if class not found

      • isEnabledMaxObjects

        public boolean isEnabledMaxObjects()
        Returns:
        true if checking for max objects is enabled, false otherwise

      • setEnabledMaxObjects

        public void setEnabledMaxObjects​(boolean enabledMaxObjects)
        Enable or disable checking for max objects that can be read. This method will also reset internal counter for read objects.
        Parameters:
        enabledMaxObjects - true or false
